member.name: T:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1
member.summary: This class is responsible for finding the best combination of compatible items. The caller supplies a collection of groups, a sorting function (to determine priority within a group), and a function to determine whether two items are incompatible. The solution (if found) will contain exactly 1 item from each group.
member.typeparam: The type of item to evaluate.

member.name: F:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1._initialDomains
member.summary: The initial domains are the full/initial candidate sets we start with when attempting to discover a solution. They need to be stored and referred to as the algorithm executes to re-initialize the current/working domains.

member.name: F:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1._currentDomains
member.summary: The current domains are initialized with the initial domains. As we progress through the algorithm, we may remove elements from the current domain as we discover that an item cannot be part of the solution. If we need to backtrack, we may reset the current domain to the corresponding initial domain.

member.name: F:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1._conflictSet
member.summary: The subset of past indexes where a conflict was found. Used to calculate the biggest and safest (i.e. not missing a better solution) jump we can make in MoveBackward.

member.name: F:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1._pastForwardChecking
member.summary: For each position, maintain a stack of past indexes that forward checked (and found/removed conflicts) from the position.

member.name: F:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1._futureForwardChecking
member.summary: For each position, maintain a stack of forward/future indexes where conflicts were found.

member.name: F:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1._reductions
member.summary: For each position, maintain a Stack of sets of items that were 'reduced' from the domain. This allows us to restore the items back into the domain on future iterations in case we need to back up, etc...

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1.FindSolution(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0}},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`0},System.Func{`0,`0,System.Boolean},System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0}})
member.summary: Entry point for the combination evalutation phase of the algorithm. The algorithm combines forward checking [FC] (i.e. trying to eliminate future possible combinations to evaluate) with Conflict-directed Back Jumping. Based off the FC-CBJ algorithm described in Prosser's Hybrid Algorithms for the Constraint Satisfaction Problem: http://archive.nyu.edu/bitstream/2451/14410/1/IS-90-10.pdf
member.param: The candidate enlistment items grouped by product.
Function supplied by the caller to sort items in preferred/priority order. 'Higher priority' items should come *first* in the sort.
Function supplied by the caller to determine whether two items are compatible or not.
Used to provide partial solutions to be used for diagnostic messages.
member.returns: The 'best' solution (if one exists). Null otherwise.

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1.MoveForward(System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Attempts to populate the element at position i with a consistent possibility and move forward to the next element in the sequence.
member.param: The position in the solution to attempt to populate.
Upon completion, set to true if the function was able to find a candidate to populate position i with. False otherwise.
member.returns: The next position to evaluate if consistent is true. If false, return value is the value to move back to.

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1.MoveBackward(System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Attempts to move back in the algorithm from position i.
member.param: The position to unset / move back from.
True if backwards move was successful and algorithm can move forward again. False if the algorithm should continue to move backwards.
member.returns: The position that the call was able to safely move back to.

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1.CheckForward(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs forward checking between the already selected element at position i and potential candidates at position j.
member.param: The position of the current element.
The position of the future domain to check against.
member.returns: True if there are still remaining possibilities in the future domain. False if all possibilities have been eliminated.

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1.UndoReductions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Undo reductions that were previously performed from position i.
member.param: The position to undo reductions from.

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.CombinationSolver`1.UpdateCurrentDomain(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reinitialize the current domain to its initial value and apply any reductions against it.
member.param: The position of the domain to update.

member.summary: Simple helper class to provide an IComparer instance based on a comparison function

member.summary: Create a unique hash code for the given set of items

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.ResolverInputSort.TreeFlatten(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{NuGet.Resolver.ResolverPackage}},NuGet.Resolver.PackageResolverContext)
member.summary:
Order package trees into a flattened list
Package Id (Parent count) Iteration 1: A(0) -> B(1) -> D(2) C(0) -> D(2) [Select A]
Iteration 2: B(0) -> D(2) C(0) -> D(2) [Select B]
Iteration 2: C(0) -> D(1) [Select C]
Result: A, B, C, D

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.ResolverInputSort.GetTreeFlattenPriority(System.String,NuGet.Resolver.PackageResolverContext)
member.summary: Packages occuring first are more likely to get their preferred version, for this reason installed packages should go first, then targets.

member.name: P:NuGet.Resolver.ResolverPackage.Absent
member.summary: An absent package represents that the package is not needed in the solution.

member.name: M:NuGet.Resolver.ResolverPackage.FindDependencyRange(System.String)
member.summary: Find the version range for the given package. The package may not exist.
Create an error message to describe the primary issue in an invalid solution.

all packages that were available for the solution
packages already installed in the project
new packages that are not already installed

This will try and get broken dependencies for target or it's dependencies WRT installed packages as well as all available packages to install
member.param: target package
last best known solution

required targets
packages in the solution, only 1 package per id should exist

member.name: P:NuGet.Resolver.Strings.DuplicateDependencyIdsError
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The package '{0}' version '{1}' declared a duplicate dependency '{2}'. This might mean the package is corrupt or the server metadata for the package is corrupt..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A fatal error occured while resolving dependencies..

member.name: P:NuGet.Resolver.Strings.InvalidPackageConfig
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to One or more unresolved package dependency constraints detected in the existing packages.config file. All dependency constraints must be resolved to add or update packages. If these packages are being updated this message may be ignored, if not the following error(s) may be blocking the current package operation: {0}.

member.name: P:NuGet.Resolver.Strings.MissingDependencyInfo
